text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
author: David Viscott

text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
author: Mark Twain

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: If you want to live a happy life, tie it to a goal, not to people or things.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The more I learn about people, the more I like my dog.
author: Mark Twain

text: In the end, it's not the years in your life that count, it's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Life is short, smile while you still have teeth.
author: Unknown

text: Life isn't about waiting for the storm to pass, it's about learning how to dance in the rain.
author: Vivian Greene

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
author: Ingrid Bergman

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

text: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

text: People say nothing is impossible, but I do nothing every day.
author: A.A. Milne

text: To love and win is the best thing. To love and lose, the next best.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

text: It does not matter how slowly you go, as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: When I was born I was so surprised I didn’t talk for a year and a half.
author: Gracie Allen

text: Love is an endless act of forgiveness. Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Laughter is an instant vacation.
author: Milton Berle

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: True love is eternal, infinite, and always like itself. It is equal and pure, without violent demonstrations: it is seen with white hairs and is always young in the heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Why do they call it rush hour when nothing moves?
author: Robin Williams

text: We are most alive when we’re in love.
author: John Updike

text: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’!
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Love is like the wind, you can't see it but you can feel it.
author: Nicholas Sparks

text: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there’s so much to smile about.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: If you’re going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.
author: Bob Marley

text: Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
author: David Wilkerson

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

text: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
author: Stephen R. Covey

text: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama
